results.abstract: Michelle Kwan wins her sixth title at United States Figure Skating Championships; photo (M)
results.snippet: On a final warm-up for the top six skaters Saturday night, Michelle Kwan stepped onto the ice only to find Sasha Cohen tagging along at a curiously close distance.    Over the next six minutes, Cohen zipped in front of Kwan at least twice in flyby...
results.lead_paragraph: On a final warm-up for the top six skaters Saturday night, Michelle Kwan stepped onto the ice only to find Sasha Cohen tagging along at a curiously close distance. Over the next six minutes, Cohen zipped in front of Kwan at least twice in flyby fashion. At one point, fans murmured as they witnessed a near calamity when Cohen brushed against Kwan, who was trying to prepare the triple jumps for her long program at the United States Figure Skating Championships.

results.abstract: Profile of Shirley Hailstock of Plainsboro, NJ, president-elect of Romance Writers of America, whose thirteenth romance novel, Family Affair, has just been published; photos (M)
results.snippet: WHEN Shirley Hailstock was a college student, about 30 years ago, she read her first romance novel. A roommate of hers at Howard University had left the book lying around and Ms. Hailstock, an avid reader, picked it up. She didn't move until she had...
results.lead_paragraph: WHEN Shirley Hailstock was a college student, about 30 years ago, she read her first romance novel. A roommate of hers at Howard University had left the book lying around and Ms. Hailstock, an avid reader, picked it up. She didn't move until she had read all 200 pages. ''I thought, 'This is really a good book,' '' she said. 'I didn't think it would be written well, but it was satisfying, well written and a good story about a first love.''

results.snippet: AT THE HANDS OF PERSONS UNKNOWN  The Lynching of Black America  By Philip Dray  Illustrated. 528 pages. Random House. $35.    RIOT AND REMEMBRANCE  The Tulsa Race War and Its Legacy  By James S. Hirsch  Illustrated. 358 pages. Houghton Mifflin. $25....
results.lead_paragraph: AT THE HANDS OF PERSONS UNKNOWN The Lynching of Black America By Philip Dray Illustrated. 528 pages. Random House. $35. RIOT AND REMEMBRANCE The Tulsa Race War and Its Legacy By James S. Hirsch Illustrated. 358 pages. Houghton Mifflin. $25. Philip Dray is the author of ''We Are Not Afraid: The Story of Goodman, Schwerner and Chaney and the Civil Rights Campaign for Mississippi.'' That book examined the 1964 killings of three civil rights workers who were arrested, subsequently abducted, brought to a remote location and summarily shot by members of the Ku Klux Klan. One measure of the impact of Mr. Dray's new book, a full and devastating history of lynching in America, is that the above incident sounds like a model of civility when compared with the monstrous brutality he has now chosen to examine.
